Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small globular jar with a very wide body, a wide mouth and a drooping, convex lip. The vessel is typical Kerma technique: a fine clay with mineral temper including a few specks of calcite, black. The surface is covered with a thick brick-red slip, polished but now flaking off.
